Module Fit_Diet_Planner
Package object

Class ExerciseEntry

java.lang.Object
object.Entry
object.ExerciseEntry
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
RepBasedExerciseEntry, TimeBasedExerciseEntry
public abstract class ExerciseEntry extends Entry
Represents a generic exercise-related entry in the system. An ExerciseEntry specifies the sport performed and the user's weight, which can be used by subclasses to calculate calories burned.

This class is abstract and must be extended by concrete exercise types (e.g., time-based or rep-based exercises).

  • Constructor Details

    • ExerciseEntry

      public ExerciseEntry(Entry.EntryType type, String note, Sport sport, double weight)
      Creates a new ExerciseEntry.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of entry (planned, planned complete, or recorded)
      note - an optional note or description for the entry
      sport - the sport or activity associated with this entry
      weight - the weight (kg) of the person performing the exercise, used for calorie calculation

    • getDisplayName

      public String getDisplayName()
      Returns a display-friendly name for this exercise entry.

      Example: "Running".

      Specified by:
      getDisplayName in class Entry
      Returns:
      the capitalized name of the sport

    • getCaloriesPreview

      public String getCaloriesPreview()
      Returns a human-readable preview of calories burned.

      The calculateCalories() method returns a negative number (e.g., -300.5) for net calorie calculations. An extra -1 is applied here to convert it back to a positive value for display purposes.

      Overrides:
      getCaloriesPreview in class Entry
      Returns:
      a string with the positive calorie burn value followed by "kcal"

    • updateFrom

      public void updateFrom(Entry newEntry)
      Updates this exercise entry with the values from another entry.

      The new entry must be an ExerciseEntry, otherwise an exception is thrown. The identifier is not changed.

      Overrides:
      updateFrom in class Entry
      Parameters:
      newEntry - the entry to copy values from
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if newEntry is not an ExerciseEntry
